gathering-Notes: Starting November 24, more than six persons are allowed to gather at home. Facemasks and a social distance of 1.5 meters are required. It is at the discretion of each family to decide how many people can be in proximity to each other and they have to make sure the rules are abided at all times. As of November 24, restaurants are allowed to have a maximum of 14 diners per table when dining inside and a maximum of 20 diners at each table when dining outdoors. However, diners must follow the rules. Everybody should be seated, while standing at the bar or dancing remains prohibited. https://web.archive.org/web/20201201023825/https:/www.government.aw/news/news_47033/item/relaxation-of-measures-starting-november-24_55282.html

No change in previous policy, no restrictions apply.    Official webpage of the Danish embassy in Afghanistan states no specific restrictions due to Covid    https://web.archive.org/web/20201120094201/https://afghanistan.um.dk/en/travel%20and%20residence/nycoronavirus-covid19/

The COVID-19 prevention and control measures in force, within the scope of the Presidential Decree on the Situation of Public Disasters, will be renewed for an additional period of 30 days, from Monday, November 23, until on the 22nd of December.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201202145145/https://governo.gov.ao/ao/noticias/governo-actualiza-medidas-de-controlo-da-covid-19/    Activities and meetings held indoors must not exceed 50% of the room capacity, nor the maximum number of 150 people.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201202150415/https://governo.gov.ao/fotos/frontend_1/gov_documentos/2020_dri_169__medidas_excepcionais_e_temporarias_3742179835f96a3aa662f8.pdf  (Official decrete regarding Covid-19 restrictions)
No policy change
No policy change

Dr. Saif Al Dhaheri, the official spokesman for the National Emergency, Crisis and Disasters Management Authority, said: “With UAE National Day , Christmas Day and New Year’s Eve celebrations fast approaching, we stress the importance of adhering to precautionary and preventative health and safety measures during all activities to tackle COVID-19.”  The rules state that concerts can only be held only after receiving approval from authorities and only with the application of all precautionary measures.  Official rules for holding celebrations cover five basic areas; public health, physical distancing regulations and policies, digital technology, sterilization and cleaning.They stress that private parties and gatherings are not allowed, areas for the isolation of sick individuals must be provided and entry and exit routes at all facilities should be clearly marked using posters.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207151748/https://english.alarabiya.net/en/News/middle-east/2020/11/18/Coronavirus-Private-parties-are-banned-on-UAE-National-Day-Christmas-and-New-Year-

"In order to protect public health against the spread of the new coronavirus, it was established that all people who live, or are temporarily, in the jurisdictions where this regulation governs must remain in their usual homes, only being able to make minimal movements and Essential to stock up on cleaning supplies, medicines and food."   https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/aislamiento

From November 22nd, up to 50 people can gather outdoors from any number of households, excluding infants under 12 months. Additionally, up to 15 visitors, including dependants, per day can visit a household, either together or separately.

Lockdown 0h-24h (until Dec 6), requirement to stay at home except for special situations (e.g. in order to prevent risk for life or property; takign care of people in need/family related obligations; coverage of daily essential needs, work or education related reasons; sports and walks; appointments with public offices or court).  https://web.archive.org/web/20201130011213/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html
No changes found since the last announcements
No policy update detected

The social contact rules will also remain in place during the Christmas period. Single people will be able to receive both their contacts at the same time on Christmas Eve or Christmas Day to meet their psychosocial well-being.    For meetings outside, the rule of four remains in force.    https://archive.vn/sek2R#selection-589.0-593.56

Targeted: According to the US Embassy Website in Bangladesh as of Nov 11, 2020 https://web.archive.org/web/20201111005505/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/:   "Currently, only certain sectors located within the Wari jurisdiction of the Dhaka South City Corporation are designated as ‘lockdown/containment’ zones. In these areas, the City Corporations will facilitate emergency response services.    It is important to note GoB officials have confirmed that the list of Red zones does not mean the areas are or will be under lockdown restrictions.    Restrictions on Designated Lockdown/Containment Areas:  - No public gatherings of any kind are allowed.  - Pedestrian and vehicular movements controlled through secured entry/exit points.  - Residents should remain within their homes except for emergencies or for essential needs.  - No indoor dining services allowed. Delivery food service options are available.  - Grocery stores and pharmacies will remain open.  - Residents will be allowed to shop in bazaars only when necessary.  - Residents must work from home.  - Transportation will be suspended. Rickshaws, vans, taxis, auto-rickshaws, and private vehicles are not permitted inside the demarcated areas during the 21-day lockdown.  - COVID-19 tests will be available to residents, and home isolation or institutional isolation will be arranged for patients who test positive.  - Shopping malls, gyms, sports complexes and recreation centres will be closed.  - Only people who are ill may go to hospitals.  - Mosques and other places of worship are closed to residents. Only official staff are permitted to enter.  - ATM services will remain open. Banks will operate in a limited capacity.  - Factories in towns will remain closed, but factories and agricultural production-related factories in rural areas can remain operational.  - Agricultural work must be performed under strict health and hygiene regulations."    This information has not changed as of Nov 18, 2020: https://web.archive.org/web/20201122221519/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/      IN GENERAL: COVID19-related restrictions seem be removed, although with strict adherence to mask wearing.  Dhaka Tribune: "On October 31, the Cabinet Division sent notices to all public offices of the country, asking them to restrict entry and to refuse service to anyone without a mask. The notice further said masks have been made compulsory for all offices, courts, shopping malls, bazaars, state or government buildings and **social events**."  source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201122215536/https://www.dhakatribune.com/health/coronavirus/2020/11/02/no-restriction-on-public-movement-to-curb-second-wave-of-covid-19    Nov 12, reuters.com: "“The decision has been taken considering the second wave... We can’t play with the lives of our children,” said a senior official of the education ministry, who declined to be named. **The government however, has lifted most other restrictions**"  source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201122212335if_/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-bangladesh-educati/bangladesh-extends-school-shutdown-over-second-covid-19-wave-idUSKBN27S26A

Shops in all Provinces can open but must limit the number of customers within the shop. This means there are queues to enter shops.  Cafés, bars and restaurants are allowed to open but must limit the opening hours, the number of customers and separate tables by 1.5 metres. Bars and discos are still closed.  The re-opening measures below apply to all of Cuba:  Public parks will be open.  Social clubs, gyms, museums, etc can re-open to a limited capacity and visitors must observe social distancing.  Swimming pools can open to a limited capacity and to restricted visit times, to allow cleaning for the next opening times.  Beaches are open, but limited numbers of people may be allowed, and there may be personnel at the beaches to manage access.  Churches are also able to re-open for services.  Provinces can start to re-open theatres and cinemas (with capacity restrictions) and hold some sporting events.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201201181436/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/cuba/coronavirus

According to the resolution of November 25th, a stricter contact restriction applies. Citizens are asked to reduce contact with other people outside of their own household to "an absolutely necessary minimum". The members of your own household and of another household may be in public together. The upper limit is 5 people from December 1st. Please also note the requirements in your region. In general, limit your private celebrations and stick to the AHA + L formula: keep your distance (1.5 meters), observe hygiene rules and wear everyday masks. Regular ventilation applies indoors. Also, note the rules in your state.

The latest update remains that there is an executive order in place, until and including the 31st January 2021, which states: “There must be a maximum of 100 people for an indoor event, provided that the rules on occupancy in the room itself of a maximum of 50% of what is allowed are also complied with. For outdoor events, there can be a maximum of 250 people.”  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201019195758/https://naalakkersuisut.gl/da/Naalakkersuisut/Nyheder/2020/07/310720-Midlertidige-restriktioner-ved-forsamlinger-mv-forlaenges

SOCIAL GATHERINGS OR CONGREGATIONS. A “congregation” or “social gathering” is a meeting for a common and singular purpose where individuals are not members of a single household. Social gatherings and congregations shall be limited to no more than five (5) persons, unless otherwise provided herein or in applicable DPHSS Guidance or Directives. The terms “social gathering” and “congregation” are not intended to include meetings of businesses, organizations, or government agencies held for the purpose of carrying out official business of such entities.  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201130173638/https://guamrecovery.com/guam-is-in-pandemic-condition-of-readiness-1-pcor-1-effective-at-1201-a-m-on-sunday-august-16-2020-through-1159-p-m-on-saturday-august-29-2020/

No change.  On the 28th of September, the Government of Kenya stated that large gatherings, meetings, conferences and political events over 15 people remain suspended. All political gatherings and rallies are suspended until January 3, 2020.  Places of worship may begin phased re-opening in conformity with applicable guidelines developed by the Inter-Faith Council. The permitted maximum size of religious gatherings is increased to one third (1/3) of its normal sitting capacity. The maximum number of persons permitted to attend funerals and weddings is reviewed upwards to 200, with all in attendance abiding with Ministry of Health Protocols.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201207144434/https://ke.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

Targeted lockdowns across the country are preventing public events or gatherings.  The local government in Pakistan Administered Kashmir, aka Azaad Kashmir, imposed a strict 15-day lockdown starting on Nov 20 2020. As per the Geo New article: "Public gatherings, including weddings, have been banned."  Similarly, in "Khyber Pakhtunkhwa: All major public gathering have been banned. Legal action will be taken in case of violations."   Such reporting suggests that public events in targeted/specific regions within the country have be halted/banned. source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201129201909/https://www.geo.tv/latest/320263-what-are-the-covid-19-restrictions-in-pakistan    In general, the Pakistan Government issued guidance on public gatherings such as weddings for crowd sizes as small as 25 people. Broadly such guidance suggests that "No indoor gatherings are permitted, and only outdoor wedding events are allowed, in which number of the guests must not exceed 300 individuals with mandatory arrangements for seating  of each individual at-least 6 feet apart. event timing should be restricted to 2 hours with closure evening timing at 10 PM" Source: https://covid.gov.pk/new_guidelines/28November2020_20201127_Additional_Guidelines_for_Marriage_Events_Ceremonies_during_COVID_19_4505.pdf    Additionally, the guidelines provide clear space restrictions for specific crowd sizes. E.g. for a gathering of upto 25 people, there should be at least 900 sq feet of space; for crowds of upto 100 people a minimum of 3600 sq ft. is required.    While the guidance document is date Nov 27th 2020, it also states that "These guidelines will be implemented from 20th November 2020 onwards in urban centers (Karachi, Lahore, Islamabad, Rawalpindi, Multan, Hyderabad, Gilgit,  Muzaffarabad, Mirpur, Peshawar, Quetta, Gujranwala, Gujrat, Faisalabad, Bahawalpur & Swat)".

There is a ban on public gatherings of over 8 people. However, the restrictions for gatherings are part of the Public Order Act and explicitly only for *public* gatherings (as cited in the C3 notes), not *private* gatherings under the definition of C4. There is no policy for private gatherings for 2 reasons. First, the rationale of the Swedish government is that it is better to issue recommendations and call on people to follow these and be responsible voluntarily, rather than impose them through legislation. With respect to gatherings, most Swedish regions have recommendations in place which ask everyone to refrain from close contact with people they don't live with and non-essential visits to indoor environments like shops, gyms, and museums, all of which are not covered under the Public Order Act. Prime Minister Stefan Löfven has said that "it's not possible to legislate common sense" but has also made clear that the rules for gathering under the Public Order Act should also set a "norm" for private gatherings, urging people to cancel dinners, parties and trips to gyms or libraries, but these kinds of gatherings are not covered by legislation. A second reason is that the Swedish constitution in its current form does not allow for limits on the number of people who meet privately.     See eg: https://web.archive.org/web/20201130183955/https://www.thelocal.se/20201116/breaking-sweden-introduces-limit-of-eight-coronavirus

"At the onset of the election campaigns, the Electoral Commission (EC) issued guidelines in line with measures to control the spread of Covid-19. The guidelines banned physical rallies and restricted town hall meetings to 70 people. This number was recently revised to 200 people per meeting. The presidential and other candidates seeking political office at various levels are expected to observe them throughout the election period with maximum compliance to the Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) issued by the Ministry of Health. As the presidential candidates traverse the country selling their agenda to voters, a disturbing trend has emerged where some candidates or their agents are addressing large crowds in blatant violation of set guidelines to control the spread of Covid-19."

in response to the COVID-19 pandemic, the local authorities of Yemen declared a nationwide health emergency and introduced many preventative measures similar to those adopted by rest of the world starting in March 2020 in order to reduce the transmission of COVID-19. These measures include the adoption of restrictions on movement countrywide.     But there is no specific restriction on public gathering but this maybe not be required as the on going civil war make gathering risky.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201029155916/https://reliefweb.int/report/yemen/covid-19-movement-restrictions-yemen-mobility-restriction-dashboard-14-21-october-2020

"Several of the most severe outbreaks emanated from large events, and it’s been decided to halve the permitted size of outdoor public gatherings to 250 people in virus hotspots, according to the president. Indoor meetings will be restricted to 100 people, down from a previous limit of 250, he said. All post-funeral gatherings will be prohibited.  ...  All post-funeral gatherings will be prohibited."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201207065904/https://www.bloomberg.com/tosv2.html?vid=&uuid=b1891d10-3859-11eb-8a9c-03e7ee6fcdf8&url=L25ld3MvYXJ0aWNsZXMvMjAyMC0xMi0wMy9yYW1hcGhvc2EtcmVpbnN0YXRlcy1jdXJicy1pbi1zb3V0aC1hZnJpY2FuLXZpcnVzLWhvdHNwb3Q=
